intro: Susilkumara rhomboidea, commonly known as the rhomboid leaf fern, is a unique plant characterized by its rhombus-shaped leaves. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is native to tropical regions of Asia. The plant features a creeping rhizome with clusters of small, lanceolate fronds. Its botanical structure supports its growth in moist, shaded environments. The fronds are typically green and possess a leathery texture.
